intro: Pouzolzia dentata, commonly known as the toothed pouzolzia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, clustered greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Native to regions of southern Africa, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland and rocky habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
